Title: Senior Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About This Position

Are you passionate about turning raw data into strategic insights that drive business success? Do you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment where you have the autonomy to shape and scale data infrastructure?

They heyData is your next stop!

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in managing our data infrastructure, developing scalable data models, and providing actionable insights to teams across the company. You'll ensure data-driven decision-making and foster a data-first culture.

Your mission


Manage & Optimize BI Infrastructure: Own and maintain our end-to-end BI setup, which currently includes Airbyte, dbt, Snowflake, and Metabase. Continuously evaluate and implement the best tools to meet our evolving needs.
Develop Scalable Data Models: Build and maintain reliable, scalable data models that ensure data integrity and accuracy across all business functions.
Drive Strategic Insights: Analyze business performance metrics, identify trends, and provide actionable recommendations to leadership and various teams.
Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product, marketing, and sales teams to understand data needs and support data-driven decision-making.
Mentorship & Alignment: Manage and upskill junior team members and ensure that data strategies align with the company‚Äôs vision and goals.
Ensure Data Governance: Implement and uphold data governance policies and industry best practices to maintain compliance and security.


What we are looking for?


5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field.Strong proficiency in SQL and experience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL, Snowflake, Redshift, etc.).
Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Metabase, or similar.
Knowledge of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing concepts.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into meaningful business insights.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with dbt is a plus.
Good knowledge of Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Experience in a startup or fast-paced environment is a plus.


Why heyData?


Your growth matters: Clear development paths, an annual & flexible learning budget, and real trust in your ideas.
Work the way that works for you: Remote, from our Berlin office, or hybrid - you decide where you‚Äôre most productive.
Time for yourself: 30 vacation days, flexible working hours, and a work culture that values focus time and supports your productivity.
State-of-the-art equipment : A MacBook & Co. to help you get started quickly
On top of that, we support in your Benefits: Urban Sports Club membership, the Deutschlandticket, a company pension plan, and more.
Team spirit that sticks: Offsites, regular team events, and honest, transparent communication on equal footing.
Be yourself: Diversity makes us stronger ‚Äì no matter where you‚Äôre from, how you identify, or where you are in life.


About Us

At heyData, we are determined to serve our mission: making Compliance easy for everybody!

At heyData, we're not just a company; we're a movement. We're reshaping the way small and medium-sized businesses embrace compliance. We set up European employees on track to reach compliance in the fastest, most intuitive, and seamless way possible. Think of us as the superheroes of compliance, and we've only just begun. With over one thousand customers we are one of the largest SMB compliance platforms in Europe and are expanding further.

But here's the real kicker ‚Äì you get to learn from a world-class team across Europe and contribute to a game-changing compliance solution that's set to revolutionize millions of SMBs. So, are you ready to be part of this incredible journey and do the most exciting work of your life? Let's make compliance history together! #heyDataLife

If the idea of making an impact excites you as much as it does us, then heyData is where you belong. This is your chance to leap into the adventure of a lifetime and set your career on fire! Reach out to us, and let's blaze a trail together in the world of business innovation! #JoinheyData

At heyData, we're proud to be a vibrant and diverse startup. We celebrate and embrace people from all backgrounds, including diverse gender, age, sexuality, religion, ethnicity, disability status parental status, and more to apply to our roles. Our team thrives on the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings. We're committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive environment where everyone can succeed. The more diverse and inclusive we are as a team, the greater our work will be.

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d) in der Gasturbinenfertigung - Befristet auf 2 Jahren
Description:
Momentaufnahme von Ihrem Tag

Willkommen bei Siemens Energy, einem weltweit f√ºhrenden Unternehmen im Bereich der Energietechnologie. Wir gestalten die Zukunft der Energieversorgung und setzen dabei auf Innovation, Nachhaltigkeit und Effizienz. Zur Verst√§rkung unseres Teams suchen wir einen engagierten Digitalisierungs-Experten (w/m/d) in der Gasturbinenfertigung, der uns dabei unterst√ºtzt, unsere ambitionierten Ziele zu erreichen. Sie werden spannende Digitalisierungs-Projekte begleiten und lenken, sowie die Fertigung und Planung mit Ihrem Fachwissen unterst√ºtzen die hohen Loadanforderungen umsetzen zu k√∂nnen.

Entwicklung und Optimierung digitaler Fertigungsprozesse mit Fokus auf Datenintegration und -transparenz
Analyse und Visualisierung von fertigungsrelevanten Daten zur Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen
Einf√ºhrung neuer digitaler Tools und Schnittstellen (z.‚ÄØB. Shyftplan, Snowflake, SnapLogic)
Zusammenarbeit mit interdisziplin√§ren Teams zur kontinuierlichen Verbesserung der Datenqualit√§t und -verf√ºgbarkeit
Dokumentation und Standardisierung von Datenmodellen und Visualisierungskonzepten
Unterst√ºtzung der internen Digitalisierungs-Roadmap



Was Sie mitbringen


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik / Informationstechnologie sowie Wirtschaftsingenieur
Mehrj√§hrige Erfahrung mit Datenbanken, APIs und Cloud-Computing-Plattformen
Ausgepr√§gte Programmierkenntnisse im Umgang mit f√ºhrenden BI-Tools (wie z.B. Tableau, PowerBI, QLIK) und ETL-Tools (wie z.B. Alteryx, Matillion), sowie Datenbanken (SQL-Kenntnisse)
Sehr gute Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch
Motivation und Entscheidungsfreudigkeit sowie Kommunikationsf√§higkeit und Teamf√§higkeit
Belastbarkeit und Handlungsf√§higkeit unter zeitlichem Druck



√úber das Team

Emissionsarme Stromerzeugung durch Technologie, L√∂sungen, Service und Dekarbonisierung. Wir verbessern und optimieren die konventionelle und erneuerbare Energieversorgung. Dadurch k√∂nnen wir unsere Energiequellen optimal nutzen, um die Energiewende zu unterst√ºtzen.

Wer ist Siemens Energy?

Wir bei Siemens Energy sind mehr als nur ein Energietechnologieunternehmen. Mit ~100,000 engagierten Mitarbeitern in mehr als 90 L√§ndern entwickeln wir die Energiesysteme der Zukunft und stellen sicher, dass der wachsende Energiebedarf der Weltgemeinschaft zuverl√§ssig und nachhaltig gedeckt wird. Die in unseren Forschungsabteilungen und Fabriken entstehenden Technologien treiben die Energiewende voran und bilden die Grundlage f√ºr ein Sechstel der weltweiten Stromerzeugung.

Unser globales Team setzt sich daf√ºr ein, nachhaltige, zuverl√§ssige und bezahlbare Energie Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen, indem es die Grenzen des M√∂glichen immer weiter hinausschiebt. Wir blicken zur√ºck auf eine 150-j√§hrige Tradition der Innovation, die unsere Suche nach Mitarbeitern best√§rkt, die unseren Fokus auf Dekarbonisierung, neue Technologien und Energiewandel unterst√ºtzen.

Hier erfahren Sie, wie Sie bei Siemens Energy etwas bewirken k√∂nnen: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

Unser Engagement f√ºr Vielfalt

Gut, dass wir nicht alle gleich sind. Vielfalt macht uns leistungsstark. Wir leben von Inklusion und unsere gemeinsame kreative Energie wird von √ºber 130 Nationalit√§ten gespeist. Siemens Energy setzt auf den Charakter - unabh√§ngig von ethnischem Hintergrund, Geschlecht, Alter, Religion, Identit√§t oder Behinderung. Wir versorgen die Gesellschaft mit Energie - die ganze Gesellschaft - und wir diskriminieren nicht aufgrund von Unterschieden, die zwischen uns bestehen.

Benefits


Neben einem attraktiven, marktgerechten Verg√ºtungspaket erwartet Sie eine attraktive arbeitgeberfinanzierte betriebliche Altersversorgung
Daneben bieten wir die M√∂glichkeit, zu sehr interessanten Mitarbeiterkonditionen Aktion√§r*in von Siemens Energy zu werden
Unter unserem Motto #BetterTogether bieten wir unseren Mitarbeitenden die M√∂glichkeit, flexibel und auch remote zu arbeiten. Aber auch unsere B√ºros lassen keine W√ºnsche offen und bieten Raum f√ºr inspirierende Zusammenarbeit und Kreativit√§t
Die berufliche und auch pers√∂nliche Weiterentwicklung unserer Mitarbeitenden ist uns ein gro√ües Anliegen. Sie haben bei uns die M√∂glichkeit selbstbestimmt zu lernen und sich zu entwickeln. Daf√ºr stehen unterschiedliche attraktive Programme und Ma√ünahmen zur Verf√ºgung
Unter dem Aspekt "Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf" haben wir ein vielf√§ltiges Angebot, z.B. flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, Kinderbetreuungspl√§tze an vielen Standorten, die M√∂glichkeit zur Schnupperteilzeit oder auch ein Sabbatical



Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit, deswegen sind Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung ausdr√ºcklich gewollt.

https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/jobs

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Join us as a (Senior) Data Analyst (m/f/d) in our Fleet Analytics team and help shape the future of autonomous mobility!


At MOIA, you'll be joining the Fleet Analytics team ‚Äì a smart, driven, and fun group of people who care deeply about using data to shape the future of mobility. We're the crew behind the central data foundation for everything fleet-related, and in a world that's moving toward self-driving vehicles, data is at the heart of it all.

We‚Äôre here to make data-informed decision-taking the norm, and we build reliable, scalable data products to support our business needs.

What We Do

  • Work cross-functionally with teams across MOIA to understand diverse data needs
  • Own and evolve the central data framework for our fleet domain
  • Collaborate and challenge each other to improve our data processes and infrastructure
  • Turn complex business questions into clear data models, KPIs, and metrics
  • Help teams meet their analytics goals and keep dashboards accurate and insightful
  • Partner with stakeholders to solve business challenges using data
  • Share knowledge and support teams in adopting and contributing to our central data setup


What you will do

As a (Senior) Data Analyst, you'll empower cross-functional product teams to efficiently leverage data and extract actionable insights for strategic decision-making while driving data-driven product development within MOIA's Fleet OS unit. Your analytical expertise will identify optimization opportunities across our R&D processes while translating complex business requirements into meaningful data products. You'll serve as the critical bridge between raw data and business impact, transforming insights into competitive advantages.


What will help you to fulfill your role

  • Several years of hands-on experience in data analytics;
  • Deep understanding of statistical methods in data analysis (experience with multivariate inferential statistics is a plus);
  • Passion for understanding and analyzing vehicle/fleet operation processes in the exciting field of Autonomous Driving;
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL (experience with DBT is a plus);
  • Use of Cloud Services (AWS, Azure, etc.);
  • Ability to efficiently deliver complex insights to diverse audiences (Product Managers, Project Managers, Senior Leaders, Embedded Engineers, etc.);
  • High level of self-organization and agency in prioritization and decision-making.
  • Proven track record in translating business needs into data products and models;
  • Experience with dashboarding/visualization tools is a plus;
  • Experience with geospatial data is a plus;


We encourage you to apply even if your profile does not meet all the requirements for the role since we are looking for a diverse range of experiences, skills, and interests. We are certain that there will be something for everyone because we are working on such a variety of tasks and embrace individual growth at MOIA.


In case you have questions regarding your application, you can approach the recruiter Dennis directly.

Title: Staff Product Analyst - (Logistics)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst - (Logistics) to join our Analytics team and shape the future of data strategy, experimentation, and impact at Delivery Hero.

In Logistics, we build products and shape processes towards an amazing delivery experience for our customers, riders, and service. In the Analytics team, we curate data to uncover insights, enable self-service discovery, and drive the strategic development of Logistics functions. Being embedded in the Product Line, we foster the ‚Äúdata-first‚Äù mindset and drive change in product development.

As a Staff Product Analyst, you‚Äôll work across multiple squads, domains, and functions within a tribe to drive end-to-end analytics excellence. You‚Äôll partner with stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Data to build impactful solutions, mentor colleagues, and help define the strategic direction of analytics across the organization. You will not only bring deep technical and business expertise to your tribe, but also champion innovation, collaboration, and quality at scale.

This is your opportunity to join a passionate, high-impact team and influence how we use data to make decisions that shape the future of local delivery.

Your mission:


Own problem-solving and solution design for highly complex business and technical challenges, balancing speed and quality.
Align product analytics lifecycle practices with business goals ‚Äì from scoping and data tracking design to data curation, analysis, visualization, and stakeholder alignment.
Lead experimentation strategy and execution across squads, guiding engineering and data science partners on implementation, tracking, and interpretation.
Define and maintain domain- and tribe-level metrics and KPIs, and ensure adoption of scalable, insightful dashboards.
Drive forward scalable analytics infrastructure, build technical capabilities, and set standards for data quality and insight generation.
Provide guidance and mentorship to other analysts, fostering a culture of knowledge-sharing and technical excellence.


Qualifications


6+ years of experience as a Product Analyst, Data Analyst, Data Scientist or similar role, preferably in fast-paced tech or internet companies.
Proven ability to lead technically complex and high-impact projects with autonomy.
Expert SQL skills and practical experience with large-scale data platforms (e.g., BigQuery).
Solid Python skills (for analytics and automation use cases).
Experience in applied statistics and designing and guiding complex A/B testing strategies
Proven track record in building scalable, user-centric dashboards and reporting tools (Tableau or similar).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities; capable of translating business goals into analytics roadmaps.
Deep understanding of product development and business strategy, with experience aligning analytics to strategic outcomes.
Demonstrated mentorship and leadership capabilities within data/analytics functions.
Self-directed, highly versatile, and solution-oriented mindset.


Nice to have:


Experience with Airflow or similar orchestration tools.
Familiarity with Git and version control for analytics workflows.
Experience contributing to analytics infrastructure and self-service tooling.
Thought leadership in the field of analytics (e.g., talks, papers, forums).


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Staff Product Analyst - Consumer Product
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Consumer Product Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by providing actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to shape the experience for millions of users across our worldwide portfolio of platforms (FoodPanda, Pedidos Ya, Woowa, Yemeksepeti, Foodora, Talabat, HungerStation, eFood, and Glovo), directly impacting customer satisfaction and driving growth. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Berlin, working closely with product directors, product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:


Strategic Impact & Product Leadership: Act as a key strategic data partner to product leadership, influencing product roadmap and investment decisions through deep analytical insights and foresight. Proactively identify high-impact analytical opportunities to drive significant customer satisfaction and business growth.
Advanced Experimentation & Causal Inference: Design, implement, and rigorously analyze A/B tests and other experimental designs (e.g., multi-variate, quasi-experiments) with a strong emphasis on advanced statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation, accurate impact measurement, and understanding causal relationships. Drive the standardization and continuous improvement of our experimentation framework across multiple brands.
Metric Framework & OKR Ownership: Define, establish, and own comprehensive product metric frameworks and quarterly OKRs. Drive alignment on "what good looks like" across product teams, ensuring clear, measurable goals that align with strategic business outcomes.
Data Integrity & Tracking Excellence: Take ownership of tracking definition and work closely with various Delivery Hero brands to significantly improve the reliability, consistency, and completeness of user behavior tracking for our discovery tools. Proactively identify and resolve data quality issues at scale.
Scalable ETL & Reporting Solutions: Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and self-service dashboards, ensuring data accessibility and empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions independently.
Deep Dive & Exploratory Analysis: Conduct complex, end-to-end exploratory analyses on large-scale user behavior data (transactional, clickstream, etc.) to uncover non-obvious insights, identify root causes of trends, and directly inform product strategy and roadmap development.
Technical & Mentorship Leadership: Contribute significantly to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge sharing sessions, best practice dissemination, workflow optimizations, and active participation in hiring and onboarding processes. Champion and drive analytical excellence within the team and broader organization.


Qualifications


9+ years of experience in product analytics or a related data-focused role, preferably within rapidly growing and dynamic environments, and with a broad mission scope or multiple stakeholders.
Experience working in Search & Recommendations systems.
Expert proficiency in SQL and Python for complex data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience with BigQuery and large-scale cloud data warehousing concepts is a strong plus.
Expertise in statistical methods applied to experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate tests, etc.), causal inference, and robust hypothesis validation. You should be able to navigate complex statistical challenges and explain methodologies clearly.
Extensive experience working with large-scale user behavior data (e.g., transactional, clickstream, app usage), including data cleaning, transformation, and analysis to derive actionable insights.
Proficiency with at least one data visualization tool such as Looker Studio (Data Studio), Tableau, QlikView, or Power BI, with a proven ability to create compelling and insightful dashboards.
Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, including senior product managers, engineers, and business leaders. You can clearly communicate complex analytical findings and successfully drive large-scale analytics projects end-to-end (e.g., defining success metrics for a tribe, standardizing measurement across brands, or implementing new experimentation methodologies).
Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, MixPanel, Snowplow, Segment, Tealium).


Nice to have:


Experience with Airflow, DBT, or other data pipelining tools
Familiarity with recommender systems, ML models, or ranking algorithms
Experience scaling analytics processes or experimentation programs across multiple teams or brands.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Consumer Product Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by providing actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to shape the experience for millions of users across our worldwide portfolio of platforms (FoodPanda, Pedidos Ya, Woowa, Yemeksepeti, Foodora, Talabat, HungerStation, eFood, and Glovo), directly impacting customer satisfaction and driving growth. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Berlin, working closely with product directors, product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:

  • Strategic Impact & Product Leadership: Act as a key strategic data partner to product leadership, influencing product roadmap and investment decisions through deep analytical insights and foresight. Proactively identify high-impact analytical opportunities to drive significant customer satisfaction and business growth.
  • Advanced Experimentation & Causal Inference: Design, implement, and rigorously analyze A/B tests and other experimental designs (e.g., multi-variate, quasi-experiments) with a strong emphasis on advanced statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation, accurate impact measurement, and understanding causal relationships. Drive the standardization and continuous improvement of our experimentation framework across multiple brands.
  • Metric Framework & OKR Ownership: Define, establish, and own comprehensive product metric frameworks and quarterly OKRs. Drive alignment on "what good looks like" across product teams, ensuring clear, measurable goals that align with strategic business outcomes.
  • Data Integrity & Tracking Excellence: Take ownership of tracking definition and work closely with various Delivery Hero brands to significantly improve the reliability, consistency, and completeness of user behavior tracking for our discovery tools. Proactively identify and resolve data quality issues at scale.
  • Scalable ETL & Reporting Solutions: Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and self-service dashboards, ensuring data accessibility and empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions independently.
  • Deep Dive & Exploratory Analysis: Conduct complex, end-to-end exploratory analyses on large-scale user behavior data (transactional, clickstream, etc.) to uncover non-obvious insights, identify root causes of trends, and directly inform product strategy and roadmap development.
  • Technical & Mentorship Leadership: Contribute significantly to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge sharing sessions, best practice dissemination, workflow optimizations, and active participation in hiring and onboarding processes. Champion and drive analytical excellence within the team and broader organization.

Qualifications

  • 9+ years of experience in product analytics or a related data-focused role, preferably within rapidly growing and dynamic environments, and with a broad mission scope or multiple stakeholders.
  • Experience working in Search & Recommendations systems.
  • Expert proficiency in SQL and Python for complex data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience with BigQuery and large-scale cloud data warehousing concepts is a strong plus.
  • Expertise in statistical methods applied to experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate tests, etc.), causal inference, and robust hypothesis validation. You should be able to navigate complex statistical challenges and explain methodologies clearly.
  • Extensive experience working with large-scale user behavior data (e.g., transactional, clickstream, app usage), including data cleaning, transformation, and analysis to derive actionable insights.
  • Proficiency with at least one data visualization tool such as Looker Studio (Data Studio), Tableau, QlikView, or Power BI, with a proven ability to create compelling and insightful dashboards.
  • Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, including senior product managers, engineers, and business leaders. You can clearly communicate complex analytical findings and successfully drive large-scale analytics projects end-to-end (e.g., defining success metrics for a tribe, standardizing measurement across brands, or implementing new experimentation methodologies).
  • Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, MixPanel, Snowplow, Segment, Tealium).

Nice to have:

  • Experience with Airflow, DBT, or other data pipelining tools
  • Familiarity with recommender systems, ML models, or ranking algorithms
  • Experience scaling analytics processes or experimentation programs across multiple teams or brands.

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Title: Data Operations Analyst ‚Äì Adsquare Data (m/f/d)
Description:
Hi there, we are‚Ä¶ a highly motivated and skilled team, where everyone's role has a real impact on the company's growth. Success and fun are combined in a great company culture with people from all over the world, that creates a melting pot of individuals with more than 20 different Nationalities!


Be part of a ambitious company whose drive is to take the advertising world into a new era
Build digital products which aim at connecting both the digital and analog world for Advertisers


Aufgaben

Own Adsquare Data Execution & Automation


Ensure Adsquare Data is prepared and delivered seamlessly
Build workflows & automation to reduce manual operational work
Monitor & improve data quality ‚Äì ensuring data is accurate, reliable, and up-to-date
Proactively identify & resolve operational bottlenecks before they impact the business


Optimise Data Distribution & Integrations


Ensure seamless data syndication across DSPs, DMPs, and platforms
Work with Data Analytics Engineers to automate taxonomy mapping & partner integrations
Implement monitoring & alerting systems to detect issues before they impact revenue


Operational Efficiency & Scalability


Improve data ingestion & monitoring processes to ensure stable data pipelines
Analyse partner usage & adoption trends to optimise performance & distribution
Drive efficiency in package management & taxonomy distribution
Collaborate with the Product & Commercial teams to support pricing & data availability


Profil


Highly passionate about data
Passionate about data operations ‚Äì ensuring smooth ingestion, processing, and delivery
A problem solver & automation enthusiast ‚Äì always looking for ways to reduce manual effort
Experienced in managing data pipelines & ingestion workflows (4+ years in Data Ops, Data Engineering, or AdTech)
Familiar with AdTech & programmatic advertising (DSPs, audience segmentation, taxonomy)
Proficient in SQL, Python, ETL workflows/DBT, cloud data infrastructure (AWS, GCP, Snowflake, etc.)
Experienced with data monitoring & quality control ‚Äì ensuring accuracy & compliance
Able to work across teams ‚Äì collaborating with Engineering, Product, and Partnerships
A self-starter who can take ownership and drive improvements in scalability & efficiency


You feel that you don't meet all but most requirements?

Wir bieten

Apply anyway. You have the chance to develop further with us.


Become part of an amazing team which is crazy enough to believe they can change how advertising is done
Unfold your abilities and to let your ideas become reality - Because everyone of us has a say in what we do


Why us?

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Data Analyst - People to join the People & Culture team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Join the team that champions the employee experience at Delivery Hero. As part of the People & Culture Team, you‚Äôll help attract, develop, and retain top talent, creating a workplace where people feel valued, supported, and empowered to grow. With each initiative you support, you‚Äôll be building a positive culture that fuels innovation, teamwork, and a sense of belonging across our global organization.

You'll collaborate closely with senior business stakeholders, People & Culture Department leaders, and regional P&C teams from across the world, transforming raw data into actionable intelligence. You‚Äôll analyze people data, identify trends, and develop strategies for optimization. Your work will directly impact decision making at Delivery Hero, fueling organizational performance and enhancements in employee experience with the generation of advanced data insights and predictive intelligence. You‚Äôll be a key contributor to improving our operational excellence and strategic planning.


Develop, maintain and improve analytical pipelines to ensure efficient data processing and reporting
Proactively analyze people data to identify trends and establish key performance metrics to monitor areas for improvement and optimization
Partner with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders through clear and concise reports and presentations. Translating technical information into digestible content to drive action plans and decision making.
Raise the bar in the data analysis of employees attrition, org design, efficiency drivers, D&I and other key metrics that bring best practices to the People & Culture department.
Drive data literacy training and upskill people partners and other key stakeholders in the use and understanding of people data.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field).
Strong critical thinking, ability to deep dive and fully understand patterns in data
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Superior storytelling, ability to write clear and engaging executive summaries with the conclusions of the data analysis produced
Strong business acumen and understanding of key concepts of human resources would be a plus
Familiarity with languages and tools for data manipulation, analysis and plotting (R, R-shiny, R-markdown, Scikit, Numpy/Scipy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Bokeh, Jupyter).


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe, Webtrekk, MixPanel, SnowPlow, Piwik, Tealium, Segment etc.)
Experience of working with multiple stakeholders, ability to clearly communicate analytical findings to them and successfully driving mid scale analytics projects end to end (e.g. establishing a performance metric for a squad - exploring, aligning on metric definition, creating data pipelines and dashboard visualization to allow self serve).

Experience with data pipelining tool such as airflow, DBT

  • Strong experience in leveraging SQL for analytics (BigQuery experience is a plus)
  • Proficient with at least one data visualization tool, including but not limited to looker studio (data studio), Tableau, Qlikview, power BI, matplotlib etc.
  • Experience working with large scale user data (transactional, click stream etc.)
  • Background in statistics, knowledge about statistical test design and analysis preferably hands on experience in designing and running A/B tests at scale
  • Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe, Webtrekk, MixPanel, SnowPlow, Piwik, Tealium, Segment etc.)
  • Experience of working with multiple stakeholders, ability to clearly communicate analytical findings to them and successfully driving mid scale analytics projects end to end (e.g. establishing a performance metric for a squad - exploring, aligning on metric definition, creating data pipelines and dashboard visualization to allow self serve).

Nice to have:

  • Experience with data pipelining tool such as airflow, DBT
  • Experience or knowledge of machine learning, recommender system, ranking algorithm.
  • Experience working in a rapidly growing and dynamic product development team

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search) and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value‚Ä¶)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Knowledge or previous experience of attribution and paid search.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Data Analyst ‚Äì People Analytics (m/f/d)
Description:
At Flix, we offer a dynamic work environment with competitive pay, strong growth opportunities, and a tech-driven approach to making travel more accessible, sustainable, and affordable.‚ÄØ

As a data-savvy Senior Data Analyst at Flix, you can make an impact by enabling the organization to make better people decisions through high-quality data infrastructure, scalable reporting solutions, and actionable people insights.

About The Role


Own and manage the HR data architecture across systems, leveraging tools like FiveTran, custom SQL pipelines, and APIs to ensure centralized and reliable data availability in Snowflake, while maintaining scalable and well-structured data models
Build and maintain data pipelines
Develop robust reporting layers in Power BI, translating raw data into intuitive and scalable dashboards for HR and leadership
Automate recurring reporting needs and build self-service analytics tools to empower HR and business leaders
Generate actionable people insights using predictive analytics techniques (e.g. turnover forecasting, engagement driver analysis) using Python or R
Work cross-functionally with stakeholders in People Partnering, Leadership, and Finance to understand business needs and translate them into clear data solutions
Ensure data quality, consistency, and compliance across the employee data lifecycle


About You


5+ years of experience in People Analytics, HR Data Engineering, Data Science or a similarly data-centric HR role, with a strong track record of owning end-to-end HR data stacks
Basic Data Engineering skills to be able to build and maintain data pipelines
Proficient in SQL (advanced queries, complex joins), building data models in Snowflake, and creating intuitive dashboards in Power BI
Comfortable using ETL/ELT tools such as FiveTran, dbt, or custom pipelines to manage data integration across systems
Experience in scripting, automation, and advanced empirical analysis in Python or R
Knowledge of Workday reporting and HRIS data extraction, with a solid grasp of HR system structures and their impact on downstream analytics
A sound understanding of key HR processes (recruiting, retention, performance, compensation) and how data can inform and optimize them
Exceptional communication and storytelling skills‚Äîyou can translate complex technical insights into impactful narratives for cross-functional HR stakeholders
Fluency in English


We recognize that everyone carries a unique set of valuable skills and experiences. If you think you could have an impact even though you don't meet 100% of the requirements, we still encourage you to apply. We want to hear from you!‚ÄØ

What We Offer


Travel perks: 12 free Flix vouchers + 12 discount vouchers for friends & family.
Work from (M)Anywhere: Depending on your role, work from another location for up to 60 days per year.
Hybrid work model: We are an office-first company, but we offer flexibility to balance work and life.
Wellbeing support: Access confidential 1:1 counselling, courses, and stress management for yourself and up to four family members.
Learning & Development: Take advantage of language classes, training courses, and expert-led sessions to grow your skills.
Mentoring Program: Connect with experienced colleagues to gain insights and accelerate your career.


To view more local benefits specific to each office location, please check out this link: Locations - Flix Career

Why Join Flix?

At Flix, you‚Äôll find teams that rally together to overcome challenges and spark creativity. We believe in ownership culture - giving you the freedom to take initiative, make an impact, and shape your own career path.

As we continue to expand across the globe, you can make a real difference in how we work.

If you‚Äôre ready to grow and lead your journey, Flix is the place for you!

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Product) | AI-Powered Learning | Berlin (Onsite)

Join One of Europe‚Äôs Fastest-Growing EdTech Scaleups




We're on a mission to build the #1 AI learning companion for 1 billion students globally.

Founded by students in 2020, this fast-growing EdTech startup is redefining how young people learn‚Äîusing AI to create truly personalized, engaging learning experiences. Already trusted by millions of students weekly, the company recently raised ‚Ç¨27M in Europe‚Äôs largest EdTech funding round in the past three years.




With a world-class team and a bold vision, they're building something generational‚Äîand this is your chance to be part of it.




Your Mission: Use Data to Shape the Future of Learning

As a Product Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be at the core of how this company builds world-class AI learning experiences. Your insights will guide what gets built, how it gets built, and why it matters.




What You'll Own

Partner with Product & Leadership to embed data into every product decision
Lead deep-dive analyses that shape personalization, feature design, and strategy
Build tools and dashboards that enable every team to move faster and smarter
Own the reliability and scalability of the data stack (BigQuery, dbt)
Ensure marketing and growth teams have clean, actionable data
Proactively monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines




Your Background

Experience in data, BI, or product analytics (startup or fast-paced environment a big plus)
Strong SQL and BI tool knowledge; Python a bonus
Familiarity with modern data stacks (e.g., dbt, BigQuery)
Clear communicator with strong critical thinking skills
Fluent in English (German a bonus)
Available to work onsite in Berlin (5 days/week with flexibility)




Why Join?

Shape a category-defining AI product that impacts students around the world
Join a mission-driven team of 60+ high-calibre builders
Be part of one of Europe‚Äôs most exciting AI startups
Work in an environment where data is at the heart of everything

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Data Platforms (m/f/d)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Analyst to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?

Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients‚Äô real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.

What You'll Do

The Senior Data Analyst position is a position within our broader International Data Science organization. The Data Science team is a diverse and talented group of individuals with strong expertise in discovering and understanding customer needs, making data-driven decisions within an ambiguous problem space, and rapidly prototyping and iterating on data products.

Building on 10 years of experience in the US, Flatiron‚Äôs international team is scaling Flatiron‚Äôs approach in new countries. Streamlined teams in each market are establishing partnerships with local cancer providers, and developing high-quality real-world data for researchers around the world. Data Scientists and Data Analysts are embedded on those teams and their work touches every aspect of Flatiron‚Äôs international product and strategy. This position specifically will be embedded on one of our Data Platforms teams which is focussed on developing tooling for curating unstructured data.

Specifically, you‚Äôll:



Collaborate with cross-functional partners to track metrics and support decision-making for clinical data processing operations
Build dashboards for internal use cases; support users by conducting ad-hoc analyses and taking action on user feedback.
Conduct analyses to provide insight into user behavior for our internal tools to help inform product decisions.
Immerse yourself in business and technical context to help your team identify opportunities for optimizing our processes and unlocking new value from our unique datasets.



Who You Are

You're a kind, collaborative and analytic problem solver and value the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition,



You have 3+ years of industry experience in relevant roles or have completed a PhD in a relevant field.
You‚Äôre impact-oriented, and care deeply about creating real change for customers, users, and ultimately patients. You choose the right, rather than the flashiest, method available to reach your goals.
You have a strong background in analytics and can fit the appropriate analysis approach to complex business or research problems.
You are a clear and confident communicator who can explain technical concepts to business and clinical partners.
You are versatile and can easily pick up new programming languages and tools, but come with strong experience in Python.
You have a record of success driving initiatives forward by generating buy-in, managing complexity, and continuously delivering business impact.
You are proficient in English.



Optional



You have experience working with healthcare-related data.



Who We Are

Our people are at the center of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity. Visit the Life at Flatiron page to learn more.
Show more

Title: Product Analyst - (Logistics Customer, Seamless)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for an experienced Product Analyst to join the Customer Product Line, Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In Logistics, we build products and shape processes towards an amazing delivery experience for our customers, riders, and service. The role is for Seamless domain in the Customer Product Line. In the Seamless Analytics team, we curate data to uncover insights, work closely with the product, enable self-service discovery, and drive the strategic development of Logistics functions. Being embedded in the Product Line, we foster the ‚Äúdata-first‚Äù mindset and drive change in product development.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-7 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and Backend Engineers and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.


Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
Own our data catalog for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs
Be an active player in working with and understanding the product end to end, its features and gaps and provide useful and necessary insights to the team to improve the product always
Ensuring proper AB testing for the features that we launch, sharing insights from the significance tests


In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

Qualifications


2-4 years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for internet companies
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
Excellent SQL skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
Intermediate Python skills, with practical experience
You are creative in data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus)
Experience with version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
Proven team player behavior and process-oriented mindset
Independent and rigorous working style, appreciation for Agile environments
Good English communication skills
Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects
Proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes
Highly passionate about data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail
Nice to have: Experience with orchestration tools such as airflow, DBT, metaflow


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. HTML:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for an experienced Product Analyst to join the Customer Product Line, Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In Logistics, we build products and shape processes towards an amazing delivery experience for our customers, riders, and service. The role is for Seamless domain in the Customer Product Line. In the Seamless Analytics team, we curate data to uncover insights, work closely with the product, enable self-service discovery, and drive the strategic development of Logistics functions. Being embedded in the Product Line, we foster the ‚Äúdata-first‚Äù mindset and drive change in product development.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-7 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and Backend Engineers and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.

  • Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
  • Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
  • Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
  • Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
  • Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
  • Own our data catalog for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs
  • Be an active player in working with and understanding the product end to end, its features and gaps and provide useful and necessary insights to the team to improve the product always
  • Ensuring proper AB testing for the features that we launch, sharing insights from the significance tests

In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

Qualifications

  • 2-4 years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for internet companies
  • Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
  • Excellent SQL skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
  • Intermediate Python skills, with practical experience
  • You are creative in data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus)
  • Experience with version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
  • Proven team player behavior and process-oriented mindset
  • Independent and rigorous working style, appreciation for Agile environments
  • Good English communication skills
  • Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects
  • Proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes
  • Highly passionate about data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail
  • Nice to have: Experience with orchestration tools such as airflow, DBT, metaflow

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.

Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for an Intern, Data Labeler (Spanish Speaker) to join the Discovery team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

At the center of our marketplace is the Discovery organization. This team is currently building Search, Recommendation, and intent collection systems to power our brands like Foodpanda, Glovo, Pedidos Ya, Talabat - serving millions of requests every day. The systems we build are critical for our online marketplaces with high availability and performance requirements and drive meaningful commercial value. They require crafting control loops through data, machine learning, and online serving systems to serve millions of consumers worldwide.

In this role you will


Accurately label and annotate various types of data, including images, text, audio, and video.
Helping us in maintaining data quality and consistency, which directly impacts users' search experience, by adhering to established guidelines.
Collaborate with the team to identify and resolve labeling discrepancies.
Provide feedback on labeling guidelines and suggest improvements.


Qualifications

Ability to deal with lots of data resources and documents
Fluency in spoken and written English & Spanish
Availability of 20 hours per week for 6 months.


Nice to have:


interest in machine learning concepts.
Experience with specific data labeling tools.

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Junior Sustainability Data Analyst | Researcher | Data Engineer (w/d/m)
Description:
80% der CO2-Emissionen von Unternehmen liegen in ihrer Lieferkette - aber Lieferketten sind komplex, es fehlt Transparenz. ctrl+s bietet Unternehmen den shortcut in die Lieferkette: Mit unserem statistischen Modell berechnen wir blitzschnell die CO2-Baseline. Unsere Lieferanten-Engagement-plattform erm√∂glicht dann die effiziente Minderung. Dabei ist unser Anspruch: WeTalkNumbers - belastbare Daten, echte Minderungen, no bullshit.




Du wirst Teil unseres Entwicklungs-Teams und unterst√ºtzt uns dabei, neue Datenquellen zu erschlie√üen, unsere Datenmodelle und Pipelines weiterzuentwickeln sowie komplexe Nachhaltigkeitsthemen zu recherchieren. Deine Vielseitigkeit ist gefragt: Du findest neue Datenquellen, bindest sie an, optimierst bestehende Prozesse und hilfst dabei, datenbasierte Erkenntnisse klar und verst√§ndlich aufzubereiten ‚Äì sei es f√ºr unsere Produkte, technische Dokumentationen oder f√ºr Kundenprojekte. Du arbeitest mit SQL, Python (oder R) und bringst ein gutes Verst√§ndnis f√ºr Datenarchitekturen und Automatisierung mit. Und was du davon noch nicht kannst ‚Äì lernst du bei uns schnell.


Aufgaben



Vielfaltige Aufgaben, die Dich nicht auf eine Deiner F√§higkeiten beschr√§nken, sondern wo Du von den Ingenieursfragen der Energieeffizienz √ºber die √ñkonometrie des Welthandels bis ins datenwissenschaftliche Data Crunching eintauchst.


Gestaltungsspielraum in einem jungen Unternehmen, das Deine Perspektive sch√§tzt


Belastbare Nachhaltigkeitsexpertise ‚Äì Du willst helfen anhand echter Daten Unternehmen Richtung net-zero zu f√ºhren.


Kund:innen, die wirklich einen Unterschied machen, weil sie einen gro√üen Hebel haben, CO2 zu sparen ‚Äì wie z.B. Siemens, Bosch, Bayer, EY und Capgemini



Qualifikation



Berufseinsteiger:innen oder junge Berufst√§tige mit maximal einem Jahr Berufserfahrung


Generalist:innen, die Freude daran haben, sich vielf√§tig einzubringen.


Die F√§higkeit, bestehende Datenarchitekturen weiterzuentwickeln und neue Datenpipelines aufzubauen.


Lust sich innerhalb kurzer Zeit in ESG-Themen einzuarbeiten, relevante datenbasierte Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und diese verst√§ndlich sowie visuell ansprechend aufzubereiten.


Studium im MINT Bereich.


Erste Erfahrungen mit SQL und R oder Python ‚Äì Kenntnisse in git sind hilfreich. Wichtig ist vor allem ein sicherer Umgang mit Daten.


Akribie - sowohl bei der Entwicklung von L√∂sungen als auch in der Dokumentation f√ºrs Team.


Interesse an unternehmerischen Umweltbelastungen und Sozialrisiken.


Die Bereitschaft Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen und den Drang Themen und Projekte auch eigenst√§ndig umzusetzen.


Deutschkenntnisse auf B1- Niveau





Gestalte gemeinsam mit uns ctrl+s!




Wir suche ab sofort und freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung bis zum 25.08.2025. unter Nennung Deiner Gehaltserwartung und fr√ºhestm√∂glichem Startdatum.

Title: Data Analyst / Datenmanager (m/w/d) im Bereich Erstattungsprozesse
Description:
Wer wir sind ‚Äì Sicherheit f√ºr Reisende, Stabilit√§t f√ºr die Reisebranche

Der Deutsche Reisesicherungsfonds (DRSF) wurde 2021 gegr√ºndet, um Pauschalreisende vor den finanziellen Folgen einer Insolvenz ihres Reiseveranstalters zu sch√ºtzen und gleichzeitig die Stabilit√§t und das Vertrauen in die Reisebranche zu sichern, indem wir Marktteilnehmer entlasten, gesetzliche Vorgaben erf√ºllen und ein effizientes Krisenmanagement im Insolvenzfall gew√§hrleisten.

Unsere Mission: Sicherstellen, dass im Falle einer Insolvenz eines Reiseanbieters Urlauber ihr Geld zur√ºckerhalten und sicher nach Hause kommen.

Aufgaben

Du bist stark in Zahlen, sicher in Strukturen und willst mit deiner Datenkompetenz echte Wirkung entfalten?

Beim Deutschen Reisesicherungsfonds gestaltest du als Data Analyst / Datenmanager (m/w/d) die Datenbasis hinter der Absicherung von Pauschalreisen.

Du verantwortest die Datenqualit√§t, steuerst ETL-Prozesse, entwickelst aussagekr√§ftige Reports und unterst√ºtzt datenbasierte Entscheidungen ‚Äì an der Schnittstelle von Datenmanagement, Reporting und Prozessoptimierung in einem Umfeld mit hoher gesellschaftlicher Relevanz.

Deine Mission


Du pflegst, strukturierst und analysierst Stamm-, Zahlungs- und Buchungsdaten in enger Abstimmung mit IT und Fachbereichen.
Du entwickelst, optimierst und dokumentierst ETL-Prozesse zur strukturierten Datenintegration aus unterschiedlichen Quellsystemen.
Du √ºberwachst Datenfl√ºsse und Schnittstellen (z.‚ÄØB. ERP-, Buchungs- oder CRM-Systeme) und definierst Anforderungen an Datenprozesse.
Du erstellst Dashboards, KPIs und automatisierte Reports mit Power BI, Excel, SQL oder Python ‚Äì verst√§ndlich und adressatengerecht.
Du sicherst Datenqualit√§t, Konsistenz und Nachvollziehbarkeit und entwickelst Standards weiter ‚Äì auch mit Blick auf Data Governance.
Du begleitest datengetriebene Prozessverbesserungen und gestaltest die Grundlage f√ºr strategische Entscheidungen


Profil


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in Datenmanagement, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber mehrj√§hrige Berufserfahrung als Data Analyst, Datenmanager oder Reporting Specialist ‚Äì idealerweise im Finanz- oder Prozessumfeld.
Du arbeitest sicher mit Power BI, Excel und hast fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL oder Python.
Du hast Erfahrung mit ETL-Strecken, Datenintegration und Datenmodellierung ‚Äì auch in komplexen Systemlandschaften.
Du denkst analytisch, dokumentierst strukturiert und verstehst es, Daten verst√§ndlich aufzubereiten und zu visualisieren.
Du bringst idealerweise Kenntnisse in agilen Methoden (Scrum, Kanban) oder Prozessmodellierung mit.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie gute Englischkenntnisse


Pers√∂nlich √úberzeugst Du Mit


Deiner sorgf√§ltigen, eigenverantwortlichen und strukturierten Arbeitsweise.
Deiner F√§higkeit, komplexe Sachverhalte verst√§ndlich zu analysieren, zu kommunizieren und L√∂sungen abzuleiten.
Deinem analytischen Blick, deinem Organisationsgeschick und deinem Wunsch, Daten wirklich nutzbar zu machen.
Deiner Offenheit f√ºr interdisziplin√§re Zusammenarbeit ‚Äì mit IT, Fachbereichen und externen Partnern.
Deiner Verl√§sslichkeit und deinem Qualit√§tsanspruch ‚Äì in Daten wie im Ergebnis.


Wir bieten


Bei uns findest du mehr als nur einen Job ‚Äì du √ºbernimmst Verantwortung in einem engagierten Team.
Ein stabiler Arbeitsplatz mit langfristigen Perspektiven
Neben einem wettbewerbsf√§higen Gehalt bieten wir auch umfangreiche Sozialleistungen.
Ob Homeoffice, flexible Arbeitszeiten oder individuelle L√∂sungen - wir wissen, dass Beruf und Privatleben vereinbar sein muss.
Deine Ideen z√§hlen ‚Äì wir f√∂rdern Eigeninitiative, Weiterentwicklung und ein respektvolles Miteinander auf Augenh√∂he.


Klingt nach dir?

Dann bewirb dich hier!

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.
