Title: Analyst, Data Operations
Description:
Teamwork makes the stream work.Roku is changing how the world watches TV

Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the U.S., Canada, and Mexico, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.

From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable - and valued - contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers around the world while gaining meaningful experience across a variety of disciplines.

¬†

About the team

The Data Operations team owns the processes and analytics for all data usage within Roku's ad platform. The position works closely with Client Services, Sales, Product, Partnerships & Engineering to drive data usage, maximize value of Roku's proprietary data and operationalize new data integrations and workflows.

¬†

About the role

A Data Operations Analyst should not only have strong analytical skill but also excellent communication capabilities and experience working closely with client facing teams. Analysts must be able to balance day to day responsibilities and tasks with long-term strategic data projects within a fast-paced environment. The position will report to the Manager of Data & Inventory Operations, as part of the larger Revenue Operations organization and is based in New York or LA.¬†¬†

For New York Only - The estimated annual salary for this position is between $129,000 - $135,000 annually.

Compensation packages are based on factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, certifications, and specific geographical location.

This role is eligible for health insurance, equity awards, life insurance, disability benefits, parental leave, wellness benefits, and paid time off.

¬†What you'll be doing
Manage data ingestion from external partners into the Roku ad platform and operationalize Roku's own data solutions¬†
Track data usage trends along with associated revenue and costs and provide analyses for internal stakeholders¬†¬†
Work closely with client services and sales to provide data recommendations and troubleshooting assistance¬†¬†
Partner with Product and Engineering teams to help develop tools and roadmaps to further business needs from the data operations perspective¬†¬†
Provide data analyses as recommendations for financial forecasting and partner contract development¬†
Create documentation and dashboards to serve as resources for cross functional teams and reduce manual processes¬†¬†
Manage outreach with vendors and publishers as needed¬†¬†
Lead & support internal cross functional training on Roku's data capabilities and processes¬†

¬†

We're excited if you have
3+ years of experience in digital or television advertising in a data, inventory, revenue operations, data analytics, finance, or business analyst role
Excellent command of Excel, SQL and working with large datasets
Experience working in a close cross functional capacity with both sales and product teams¬†
Experience creating reports with data visualization platform like Tableau, Looker, etc.¬†
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to take complicated subject matter and communicate it clearly and effectively for any audience
Self-starter, comfortable working autonomously in fast-paced, growing environment

¬†

Benefits

Roku is committed to offering a diverse range of benefits as part of our compensation package to support our employees and their families. Our comprehensive benefits include global access to mental health and financial wellness support and resources. Local benefits include statutory and voluntary benefits which may include healthcare (medical, dental, and vision), life, accident, disability, commuter, and retirement options (401(k)/pension). Our employees can take time off work for vacation and other personal reasons to balance their evolving work and life needs. It's important to note that not every benefit is available in all locations or for every role. For details specific to your location, please consult with your recruiter.

¬†

The Roku Culture

Roku is a great place for people who want to work in a fast-paced environment where everyone is focused on the company's success rather than their own. We try to surround ourselves with people who are great at their jobs, who are easy to work with, and who keep their egos in check. We appreciate a sense of humor. We believe a fewer number of very talented folks can do more for less cost than a larger number of less talented teams. We're independent thinkers with big ideas who act boldly, move fast and accomplish extraordinary things through collaboration and trust. In short, at Roku you'll be part of a company that's changing how the world watches TV.‚ÄØ

We have a unique culture that we are proud of. We think of ourselves primarily as problem-solvers, which itself is a two-part idea. We come up with the solution, but the solution isn't real until it is built and delivered to the customer. That penchant for action gives us a pragmatic approach to innovation, one that has served us well since 2002.‚ÄØ

To learn more about Roku, our global footprint, and how we've grown, visit https://www.weareroku.com/factsheet.

By providing your information, you acknowledge that you have read our Applicant Privacy Notice and authorize Roku to process your data subject to those terms.

Title: Data Analyst - People Analytics
Description:
Data Analysts in People Analytics drive the business by empowering HR and business leaders to incorporate people insights into workforce and business decisions. In this role, you will create analysis with people data, create dashboards for scaled solutions and efficient reporting, and develop materials for the executive leaders of the company to drive strategy. You will partner with People Analytics teams to influence priorities, perform research and build solutions for the future. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated analytical and technical skills, experience creating data-driven executive level presentations and will thrive managing concurrent projects while working with a cross-functional team. We are looking for someone who enjoys building, figuring out the best way to achieve results, and working closely with teams across Meta to solve complex problems.

Data Analyst - People Analytics Responsibilities:


Apply expertise in data analytics to identify business relevant insights and develop executive level presentations to influence people strategy
Act as an internal consultant and partner to HR and business leaders and engage with the broader analytics community to deliver insights, research and scalable solutions
Focus on impact and propose metrics to understand success of People initiatives
Manage multiple concurrent projects that require inputs from cross-functional stakeholders, while balancing impact on business needs
Deliver analytical findings to executive audiences
Leverage data analysis tools, such as Python, R, SQL, Tableau, and spreadsheets to develop models, understand trends, and extract insights
Demonstrate exceptional judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data


Minimum Qualifications:


BA/BS in Engineering, Industrial Psychology, Data Science, or related field with 5+ years (or MBA/MA/MS with 4+ years or PhD and 3+ years) experience in fields such as analytics, management consulting, sales operations, finance, compensation, or related areas
5+ years of data analysis, quantitative / qualitative research, experience gathering and evaluating data and validating hypotheses
3+ years of SQL, data modeling and advanced querying
3+ years of program management, directing tasks and managing multiple streams of work
Experience engaging directly with executive stakeholders and managing relationships
3+ years of experience in data visualization tools (for example, Tableau) and spreadsheets (complex formulas, pivots, macros, etc.)
3+ years of storytelling with data, communicating technical results to technical and non-technical audiences


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience working with HR/organizational people data (e.g. headcount, turnover, recruiting metrics, and other people analytics)
Experience working across various levels of an organization, while building trust and fostering collaboration
2+ years of experience in dashboard development using advanced Tableau functionality (e.g. data blending)
5+ years of experience in SQL and data pipeline development and automation
3+ years of experience with Python or R and developing solutions that scale


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$124,000/year to $176,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What is Cirkul?

Cirkul is a rapidly growing beverage technology company on a mission to make a healthier world by helping people enjoy drinking more water.

The team at Cirkul developed an innovative beverage delivery system that makes drinking more water delicious, fun, and personalized. The technology reduces the shipping weight of bottled beverages by 96% and uses 84% less plastic. Cirkul offers its customers 100+ unique flavors, all with no sugar, zero calories, no artificial colors, and a range of functional enhancements online, at Walmart, and other retailers across the United States. Hundreds of thousands of consumers are using Cirkul to transition from single-use plastics and sugar-filled beverages to healthier, better-for-you alternatives.

What is this role?

As a Data Analyst for Cirkul, you will be tackling challenges across Growth/Marketing, Finance, Retail, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and Customer Support teams to quickly deliver insights through analysis, experimentation and reporting. Additionally, you will develop business processes to scale analytics to support a hyper growth business.

The ideal candidate must be able to roll up his/her sleeves to work independently and own delivery results. He/she must have the ability to prioritize issues under manager‚Äôs guidance, deal with ambiguity, seek help when needed and manage conflicting deadlines.

What does an average day look like?

Driving Results:


Design and develop KPIs tracking business performance across departments
Build and automate tools to surface key data to stakeholders across a broad range of data literacy levels


Taking Ownership:


Monitor KPIs to identify potential opportunities to improve company performance


Making Decisions:


Collect, analyze, and explain data to key stakeholders and executive leadership


Cultivating Relationships:


Be a data evangelist: collaborate with both technical and non-technical teammates to supplement decisions with quantitative evidence


Instilling Trust:


Always auditing: build and maintain processes to track data and troubleshoot errors


Customer Focus:


Provide ad hoc analysis and forecasting as needed across a diverse set of teams
Evaluate reporting needs and work with key stakeholders to prioritize overall strategy of the data team in answering company goals


What background should you have?


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Finance or equivalent quantitative degree. Master‚Äôs preferred
1+ year of experience preferred
Data-driven, detail-oriented individual with excellent analysis and problem-solving abilities
Fluency in data analysis and data-driven problem solving; a track record of using data to communicate results to key stakeholders
Experience with experimentation and statistical analysis
Excellent verbal and written communication skills: the ability to present complex data in a digestible format to stakeholders of all data literacy levels
Fluency with advanced SQL and Python
Comfortable creating dashboards in a BI framework such as PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, or comparable tools
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously: superb time management and prioritization ability


What do we offer?


Competitive salary based on experience and market
Generous benefits, 401k match, and PTO (even insurance for your fur babies!)
Employee discounts on Cirkul products
New corporate office space with great amenities
Opportunity to work with a best in class team, in a hyper growth company, taking over the hydration industry
A culture that rewards results


Please review our privacy policy here.

Cirkul, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe in hiring a diverse workforce and are committed to sustaining an equitable and inclusive, people-first environment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents.

Title: Data Analyst, Analytics Insights
Description:
Job Title

Data Analyst, Analytics Insights

Requisition ID

R025793

Job Description

Your Platform

We‚Äôre headquartered in Santa Monica, California, housing multiple teams across many fields of Marketing, PR, Sales, Supply Chain, and other corporate functions such as HR, IT, Legal, Facilities, and Finance. Santa Monica is the nerve center of our company, where the best ideas combine with unrivaled rigor to create the biggest and best entertainment experiences in the world.

Your Mission Is

The Analytics Insights team is seeking a talented Intermediate Data Analyst to work directly with our studios and Call of Duty (COD) Live Services Team. As part of the Insights team, your mission will be to drive data-driven decision-making. You‚Äôll collaborate with designers, engineers, business stakeholders, Activision leadership, and analytics peers to derive meaningful insights that enhance gameplay design and guide commercial strategies. Partner with our Live Services business unit to optimize game features to aid in driving player engagement and monetization.

Responsibilities


Partner with the Live Services Team to optimize game features, balance game economies, and identify new ways to boost player engagement.
Collaborate with studios to analyze core game systems, implementing gameplay analytics that aligns with the development goals of designers and engineers.
Support and drive analytics initiatives within a cross-functional team to inform design and implementation decisions, both current and future.
Present analytical findings and recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences, translating complex data into actionable insights.


What You Bring To The Team

You‚Äôre a motivated data expert eager to expand your analytics toolkit in a fast-paced environment, focused on delivering high-impact insights to stakeholders, and driven by a passion for video games. Success in this role is reflected in:


Measurable Impact: Demonstrating consistent influence of analytics on revenue, engagement, and player experience.
Collaboration: Leveraging your relationship-building skills to foster trust and teamwork with both internal and studio partners.
Effective Communication: Managing your time and stakeholder expectations with clear, concise updates and insights.
Insight Translation: Delivering precise, actionable insights that drive decisions and improvements.
Domain Knowledge: Understanding the player mindset to derive and communicate insights that shape design and engagement strategies.


Player Skills


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a technical field (e.g., data analytics, data science, statistics, economics, or mathematics).
3+ years of experience with SQL and R/Python for data analysis and visualization.
A passion for storytelling through data, turning complex datasets into compelling narratives.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to manage diverse stakeholder relationships and expectations.
Experience in gameplay analysis or knowledge of user engagement and monetization strategies in gaming, entertainment, e-commerce, or mobile apps is a plus.


Our World

At Activision, we strive to create the most iconic brands in gaming and entertainment. We‚Äôre driven by our mission to deliver unrivaled gaming experiences for the world to enjoy, together. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty¬Æ, Crash Bandicoot‚Ñ¢, Tony Hawk‚Äôs‚Ñ¢ Pro Skater‚Ñ¢, and Guitar Hero¬Æ. As a leading worldwide developer, publisher and distributor of interactive entertainment and products, our ‚Äúpress start‚Äù is simple: delight hundreds of millions of players around the world with innovative, fun, thrilling, and engaging entertainment experiences.

We‚Äôre not just looking back at our decades-long legacy; we‚Äôre forging ahead to keep advancing gameplay with some of the most popular titles and sophisticated technology in the world. We have bold ambitions to create the most inclusive company as we know our success comes from the passionate, creative, and diverse teams within our organization.

We‚Äôre in the business of delivering fun and unforgettable entertainment for our player community to enjoy. And our future opportunities have never been greater ‚Äî this could be your opportunity to level up.

Ready to Activate Your Future?

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against based on disability.

Rewards

Requirements

We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‚ÄòEvery World‚Äô - we‚Äôve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:


Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&D insurance, disability insurance;
401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;
If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.

Job Title

Data Analyst, Analytics Insights

Requisition ID

R025793

Job Description

Your Platform

We‚Äôre headquartered in Santa Monica, California, housing multiple teams across many fields of Marketing, PR, Sales, Supply Chain, and other corporate functions such as HR, IT, Legal, Facilities, and Finance. Santa Monica is the nerve center of our company, where the best ideas combine with unrivaled rigor to create the biggest and best entertainment experiences in the world.

Your Mission Is

The Analytics Insights team is seeking a talented Intermediate Data Analyst to work directly with our studios and Call of Duty (COD) Live Services Team. As part of the Insights team, your mission will be to drive data-driven decision-making. You‚Äôll collaborate with designers, engineers, business stakeholders, Activision leadership, and analytics peers to derive meaningful insights that enhance gameplay design and guide commercial strategies. Partner with our Live Services business unit to optimize game features to aid in driving player engagement and monetization.

Responsibilities

  • Partner with the Live Services Team to optimize game features, balance game economies, and identify new ways to boost player engagement.
  • Collaborate with studios to analyze core game systems, implementing gameplay analytics that aligns with the development goals of designers and engineers.
  • Support and drive analytics initiatives within a cross-functional team to inform design and implementation decisions, both current and future.
  • Present analytical findings and recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences, translating complex data into actionable insights.

What You Bring To The Team

You‚Äôre a motivated data expert eager to expand your analytics toolkit in a fast-paced environment, focused on delivering high-impact insights to stakeholders, and driven by a passion for video games. Success in this role is reflected in:

  • Measurable Impact: Demonstrating consistent influence of analytics on revenue, engagement, and player experience.
  • Collaboration: Leveraging your relationship-building skills to foster trust and teamwork with both internal and studio partners.
  • Effective Communication: Managing your time and stakeholder expectations with clear, concise updates and insights.
  • Insight Translation: Delivering precise, actionable insights that drive decisions and improvements.
  • Domain Knowledge: Understanding the player mindset to derive and communicate insights that shape design and engagement strategies.

Player Skills

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a technical field (e.g., data analytics, data science, statistics, economics, or mathematics).
  • 3+ years of experience with SQL and R/Python for data analysis and visualization.
  • A passion for storytelling through data, turning complex datasets into compelling narratives.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to manage diverse stakeholder relationships and expectations.
  • Experience in gameplay analysis or knowledge of user engagement and monetization strategies in gaming, entertainment, e-commerce, or mobile apps is a plus.

Our World

At Activision, we strive to create the most iconic brands in gaming and entertainment. We‚Äôre driven by our mission to deliver unrivaled gaming experiences for the world to enjoy, together. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty¬Æ, Crash Bandicoot‚Ñ¢, Tony Hawk‚Äôs‚Ñ¢ Pro Skater‚Ñ¢, and Guitar Hero¬Æ. As a leading worldwide developer, publisher and distributor of interactive entertainment and products, our ‚Äúpress start‚Äù is simple: delight hundreds of millions of players around the world with innovative, fun, thrilling, and engaging entertainment experiences.

We‚Äôre not just looking back at our decades-long legacy; we‚Äôre forging ahead to keep advancing gameplay with some of the most popular titles and sophisticated technology in the world. We have bold ambitions to create the most inclusive company as we know our success comes from the passionate, creative, and diverse teams within our organization.

We‚Äôre in the business of delivering fun and unforgettable entertainment for our player community to enjoy. And our future opportunities have never been greater ‚Äî this could be your opportunity to level up.

Ready to Activate Your Future?

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against based on disability.

Rewards

Requirements

We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‚ÄòEvery World‚Äô - we‚Äôve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:

  • Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&D insurance, disability insurance;
  • 401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
  • Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
  • Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;
  • If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.

Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company. You can learn more by visiting https://www.benefitsforeveryworld.com/.

In the U.S., the standard base pay range for this role is $34.28 - $63.42 Hourly. These values reflect the expected base pay range of new hires across all U.S. locations. Ultimately, your specific range and offer will be based on several factors, including relevant experience, performance, and work location. Your Talent Professional can share this role‚Äôs range details for your local geography during the hiring process. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed. While we strive to provide competitive offers to successful candidates, new hire compensation is negotiable.

Title: Data Analyst - People Analytics
Description:
Data Analysts in People Analytics drive the business by empowering HR and business leaders to incorporate people insights into workforce and business decisions. In this role, you will create analysis with people data, create dashboards for scaled solutions and efficient reporting, and develop materials for the executive leaders of the company to drive strategy. You will partner with People Analytics teams to influence priorities, perform research and build solutions for the future. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated analytical and technical skills, experience creating data-driven executive level presentations and will thrive managing concurrent projects while working with a cross-functional team. We are looking for someone who enjoys building, figuring out the best way to achieve results, and working closely with teams across Meta to solve complex problems.

Data Analyst - People Analytics Responsibilities:


Apply expertise in data analytics to identify business relevant insights and develop executive level presentations to influence people strategy
Act as an internal consultant and partner to HR and business leaders and engage with the broader analytics community to deliver insights, research and scalable solutions
Focus on impact and propose metrics to understand success of People initiatives
Manage multiple concurrent projects that require inputs from cross-functional stakeholders, while balancing impact on business needs
Deliver analytical findings to executive audiences
Leverage data analysis tools, such as Python, R, SQL, Tableau, and spreadsheets to develop models, understand trends, and extract insights
Demonstrate exceptional judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data


Minimum Qualifications:


BA/BS in Engineering, Industrial Psychology, Data Science, or related field with 5+ years (or MBA/MA/MS with 4+ years or PhD and 3+ years) experience in fields such as analytics, management consulting, sales operations, finance, compensation, or related areas
5+ years of data analysis, quantitative / qualitative research, experience gathering and evaluating data and validating hypotheses
3+ years of SQL, data modeling and advanced querying
3+ years of program management, directing tasks and managing multiple streams of work
Experience engaging directly with executive stakeholders and managing relationships
3+ years of experience in data visualization tools (for example, Tableau) and spreadsheets (complex formulas, pivots, macros, etc.)
3+ years of storytelling with data, communicating technical results to technical and non-technical audiences


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience working with HR/organizational people data (e.g. headcount, turnover, recruiting metrics, and other people analytics)
Experience working across various levels of an organization, while building trust and fostering collaboration
2+ years of experience in dashboard development using advanced Tableau functionality (e.g. data blending)
5+ years of experience in SQL and data pipeline development and automation
3+ years of experience with Python or R and developing solutions that scale


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$124,000/year to $176,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
The Company
PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.

We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.

We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.

Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do ‚Äì and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.

Job Description Summary:
This job will analyze data to design and build BI dashboards (in React.Js and Looker) in short timeframes via rapid prototyping and agile development to provide insights that support business decisions. And your role would involve hands on development, and maintenance of all aspects of BI solutions ‚Äì ETL, Data Quality, Visualisation, Documentation, and Production movement.

Job Description:
Essential Responsibilities:


Analyze data to provide insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs.
Deliver recommendations based on data analysis.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all analysis processes.
Present findings to stakeholders.
Drive continuous improvement in data analysis practices.



Minimum Qualifications:


Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience and a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.



PayPal is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.

Actual Compensation is based on various factors including but not limited to work location, and relevant skills and experience.

The total compensation for this practice may include an annual performance bonus (or other incentive compensation, as applicable), equity, and medical, dental, vision, and other benefits. For more information, visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com.

The U.S. national annual pay range for this role is PayPal is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.

Actual Compensation is based on various factors including but not limited to work location, and relevant skills and experience.

The total compensation for this practice may include an annual performance bonus (or other incentive compensation, as applicable), equity, and medical, dental, vision, and other benefits. For more information, visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com.

The U.S. national annual pay range for this role is $62,000 to $102,300

PayPal does not charge candidates any fees for courses, applications, resume reviews, interviews, background checks, or onboarding. Any such request is a red flag and likely part of a scam. To learn more about how to identify and avoid recruitment fraud please visit https://careers.pypl.com/contact-us.

For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.

Our Benefits:

At PayPal, we‚Äôre committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can‚Äôt do this without our most important asset-you. That‚Äôs why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com

Who We Are:

To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.

Belonging at PayPal:

Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.

Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don‚Äôt hesitate to apply.

Notice to Applicants and Employees who reside within New York city. Click https://careers.pypl.com/Contact-Us/default.aspx

to view the notice.

  • Leverage data analysis tools, such as Python, R, SQL, Tableau, and spreadsheets to develop models, understand trends, and extract insights
  • Demonstrate exceptional judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data

Minimum Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in Engineering, Industrial Psychology, Data Science, or related field with 5+ years (or MBA/MA/MS with 4+ years or PhD and 3+ years) experience in fields such as analytics, management consulting, sales operations, finance, compensation, or related areas
  • 5+ years of data analysis, quantitative / qualitative research, experience gathering and evaluating data and validating hypotheses
  • 3+ years of SQL, data modeling and advanced querying
  • 3+ years of program management, directing tasks and managing multiple streams of work
  • Experience engaging directly with executive stakeholders and managing relationships
  • 3+ years of experience in data visualization tools (for example, Tableau) and spreadsheets (complex formulas, pivots, macros, etc.)
  • 3+ years of storytelling with data, communicating technical results to technical and non-technical audiences

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working with HR/organizational people data (e.g. headcount, turnover, recruiting metrics, and other people analytics)
  • Experience working across various levels of an organization, while building trust and fostering collaboration
  • 2+ years of experience in dashboard development using advanced Tableau functionality (e.g. data blending)
  • 5+ years of experience in SQL and data pipeline development and automation
  • 3+ years of experience with Python or R and developing solutions that scale

About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$124,000/year to $176,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Data Analyst- $150,000-$200,000 + bonus!
Description:
Interested in empowering investment decisions through data?




Join this multi-strategy hedge fund in their New York office as a data engineer. Their teams foster a collaborative, innovative, and data-focused environment.




In this role, they are looking for a data analyst/scientist to join the team that is responsible for data that enables research, testing, and execution of investment strategies. You will be responsible for sourcing, analyzing, and cleaning vendor datasets to integrate them into the rest of the data platform. The core of this role involves curating data products, implementing data quality checks, and interacting with vendors.




The key to this opportunity is being able to understand how data benefits the business and working with the business to deliver data in a way that supports investments and ultimately improves the bottom line by working directly with portfolio managers.




You will have expert level Python and SQL skills, especially in Pandas, Polars, or Snowpark and with other languages such as C#, F#, C++, or Java. You will also have experience with querying technologies like Snowflake or Redshift.




Experience with test automation will also be necessary in this role and using monitoring production systems like Grafana/Prometheus, Datadog, or ELK. You will also have experience working closely with financial data in either market or reference data.




Are you ready to take the next step in your career?




Apply now! No up-to-date resume required.




Salary: $150,000-$200,000




Onsite 5 days per week.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
```html

About the Company







Journey with us! Combine your career goals and sense of adventure by joining our incredible team of employees at Royal Caribbean Group. We are proud to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, and excellent career development opportunities, each offering unique ways to explore the world. We are proud to be the vacation-industry leader with global brands ‚Äî including Royal Caribbean International, Celebrity Cruises and Silversea Cruises ‚Äî the most innovative fleet and private destinations, and the best people. Together, we are dedicated to turning the vacation of a lifetime into a lifetime of vacations for our guests.







About the Role







Royal Caribbean Group‚Äôs Revenue Planning & Analysis has an exciting career opportunity for a full time Analyst Engineer, Data reporting to the Sr. Mgr, RM Dev & Systems. This position will work on-site in Miami, Florida.







Responsibilities







Meet with business stakeholders to clarify and document reporting requirements
Works with management & other team members to understand & clarify data analysis and reporting needs
Meet with technical stakeholders to perform code reviews and elicit feedback
Assist in developing, implementing, and maintaining business intelligence reporting and user tools
Recommend data architecture and engineering structures necessary to support reports
Develop new reporting by creating new queries or coding new processes. Aggregates large data sets in SQL, Python, and other analytical tools for analysis.
Develops data strategies, specifically around data structures, identifying critical information, as well as the tools used to retrieve and analyze the data.
Performs research and analysis on large data sets - data exploration, trending, etc.
Continuously search for potential business improvements, revenue opportunity and efficiency gains.
Clearly explain tools and results to teams and management.
Develop and conduct clear, concise presentations, communicating technical methods and impacts in business terms.
Performs other duties as required. This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position. Employees will be required to perform any other job-related duties assigned by their supervisor or management.




Qualifications







Bachelor's degree preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Analytics, Business, Engineering or BS/BA with combination thereof and related analytic work experience or relevant certifications.
2 years of work experience in data analysis, data mining, business case development or other related analytical projects.
Equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.




Required Skills







Strong proficiency in query/reporting tools, SQL, Python or other development tools.
Understanding of forecasting, data cleansing and transformations.
Experience working with databases, including Oracle, Databricks, or SQL Server.
Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to develop and implement applications using programming languages.
Experience with SQL required.
Experience in supporting and interpreting reporting using business Intelligence tools (Azure, Synapse, and Databricks experience a plus).
Ability to handle dynamic workload, balancing short- and long-term projects.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively to business and technical audiences in both spoken and written formats.




Preferred Skills







Experience in supporting and interpreting reporting using business Intelligence tools (Azure, Synapse, and Databricks experience a plus).




Pay range and compensation package







We are proud to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package.







Equal Opportunity Statement







We know there's a lot to consider. As you go through the application process, our recruiters will be glad to provide guidance, and more relevant details to answer any additional questions. Thank you again for your interest in Royal Caribbean Group. We'll hope to see you onboard soon!




```

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Employment Type: Full-Time, Direct Hire

Location: New York, NY (Hybrid)

Overview

We are looking for an analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our data team supporting high-impact financial operations. This role is geared toward individuals with a strong foundation in analytics and data manipulation, particularly in environments such as private equity, hedge funds, fintech, or investment banking. The ideal candidate will bring technical proficiency, financial insight, and a passion for uncovering actionable insights from complex datasets.

Key Responsibilities

Analyze large-scale financial datasets to uncover patterns, trends, and opportunities
Design and execute data workflows for modeling, forecasting, and operational reporting
Build and maintain dashboards and reporting tools using Power BI and advanced Excel (including macros and VLOOKUP)
Write and optimize queries in SQL and develop scripts in Python to support analytical initiatives
Collaborate with business teams to define data requirements and deliver insights for decision-making
Support machine learning and predictive modeling projects aimed at strategic investment and financial planning
Ensure data integrity and compliance with quality standards in a cloud-driven environment

Required Qualifications

3‚Äì5 years of experience in data analysis roles, ideally in financial services
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Excel with advanced functions (macros, VLOOKUP, pivot tables)
Experience using Power BI or similar data visualization tools
Strong understanding of data manipulation, data modeling, and analytics workflows
Ability to translate complex datasets into clear business insights
Familiarity with ML and predictive modeling techniques for financial applications

Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Finance, or a related field
Prior experience in high-growth fintech, hedge funds, or investment banking analytics teams
Certification in SQL development, BI tools, or Python programming is a plus

Work Environment

Hybrid work structure with onsite presence in New York, NY
Fast-paced, data-driven culture combining technology innovation with financial strategy

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
FM Talent Source is an enterprise that provides business and workforce solutions to help organizations nationwide overcome business challenges. Our clients include federal, state and local government agencies, Fortune 500 Companies, and non-profit organizations. Founded in 2004, we have a strong history of providing recruitment strategies and utilizing effective project and quality management methodologies to ensure our clients‚Äô success.




We are currently looking for a Data Analyst/Program Specialist to support our client the Office of Head start/ Early Head Start in Dallas, TX.







ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES

Prepares reports, charts, graphs, and statistical and narrative data required for presentations and briefings.
Conducts comprehensive business process analyses to evaluate end-to-end engineer work processes for key client programs.
Involvement in developing, writing, and reviewing regulations and other policy issuances.
Leads policy issues related to data analysis.
Supports the design of requirements related to the development of data systems.
Analyzes a wide range of qualitative and quantitative methods to assess the efficiency of programs, projects, and other broad strategic initiatives.
Manages data gathering activities and assists in ensuring maximum effectiveness in the quality of statistical analyses.
Presents recommendations and findings, identifies trends, and generates innovative suggestions for management improvements.
Drafts all charts/graphs/tables as needed for reports/presentations/briefings.
Maintains a high level of confidentiality due to the sensitive nature of data obtained under documents handled.
Coordinates with data stewards/data stakeholders on project plans.
Drafts documents based on results of data analysis.
Maintains project plans, updating as necessary.
Maintains budget spreadsheets, updating as necessary.
Drafts standard operating procedures and office policies.
Executes common management standards and business practices to ensure all assigned tasks meet established goals, objectives, and milestones.




ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS

BA/BS with 3‚Äì6 years of related experience conducting data analysis for federal clients or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Previous government agency experience highly desired, especially with Head Start data maintenance.
Must have federal clearance or be able to obtain clearance.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills.
Ability to develop tables, reports, create visualizations, and present results that logically support data-driven conclusions.
Demonstrated expertise in Excel (pivot tables, macros, functions, formulas, etc.).
Experience developing analytic writing and presentations for audiences with varying levels of familiarity.
High-functioning knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, Access, PowerPoint, SharePoint).
Ability to work on multiple assignments with deadlines and deliverables.
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.




Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Sr Analyst, Forecasting - CNN Data Analytics, Science & Insights
Description:
Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery‚Ä¶ the stuff dreams are made of.

Who We Are‚Ä¶

When we say, ‚Äúthe stuff dreams are made of,‚Äù we‚Äôre not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD‚Äôs vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what‚Äôs next‚Ä¶

From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

We are the now and the next. The power behind the people building the future. We are born from the spirit of innovation. We are created from the idea that people around the world want more, need more, deserve more. We are the home of the global digital revolution. We are CNN.

To see what it‚Äôs like to work at CNN, follow @WBDLife on Instagram and X!

We are CNN... THE WORLD'S MOST ESSENTIAL AND ENGAGING SOURCE OF DIGITAL NEWS. We are in the midst of rapid transformation and need our next generation of innovators, makers, and dreamers who will lead and drive our growth. We aim to make the world a better, more connected place.

Your New Role...

CNN is seeking a Senior Analyst within the growth analytics team to own the drivers-based business forecasting for our Streaming initiatives. This role requires both the technical expertise to build and automate granular forecasting systems and pair that with the understanding of how individual business initiatives can realistically drive bottom-line outcomes. This individual should be self-motivated, work well independently and as part of a team, and be passionate about what they do.

Your Role Accountabilities...


Manage, own, and evolve a drivers-based forecasting model for Streaming subscription offerings.
Develop and refine forecasting methodologies using best-in-class methods to model acquisition and retention behavior and estimate how those and other metrics will be impacted by key business initiatives.
Partner with cross-functional teams such as Finance, Growth, and Strategy to align forecast assumptions with business strategy and operational plans.
Build and maintain automated dashboards and reporting tools to communicate forecast outputs, trends, and insights to stakeholders and senior leadership.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive business outcomes.
Collaborate with data engineering and platform teams to ensure data pipelines and models have the appropriate granularity and business logic.
Lead deep-dive analyses to understand deviations from forecast, uncover underlying drivers, and recommend corrective actions.
Document and socialize key forecasting assumptions, methodologies, and definitions to ensure transparency and alignment across the organization.


Qualifications & Experience...


3+ years of experience in analytics.
Significant experience using SQL to explore and analyze large data sets in cloud environments.
Experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools such as Looker and Tableau.
A proven track record of providing actionable insights that drive business impact in the form of revenue or profit.
Logical mindset capable of making appropriate trade-offs between speed and analytical depth without sacrificing quality.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to motivate, collaborate and influence cross-functional partners.
Ability to deliver on multiple projects and meet tight deadlines.
Ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels.
Collaborative approach to partnership.
Comfortable communicating with a diverse set of backgrounds, seniority levels, and knowledge sets, particularly in translating complex data concepts to strategic recommendations.
A self-starter who is passionate about getting data, using data, making sense of data, and helping others benefit from making analytics driven decisions.


Nice To Haves...


Experience building bottom-up forecasts.
Experience unpacking gaps to forecast for business leaders in prior roles.
BA/BS in statistics, mathematics, economics, or other quantitative discipline.
Experience in Python or R.


How We Get Things Done‚Ä¶

This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

Championing Inclusion at WBD

Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

If you‚Äôre a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request.

In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery‚Äôs total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $75,390.00 - $140,010.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

  • Build and maintain automated dashboards and reporting tools to communicate forecast outputs, trends, and insights to stakeholders and senior leadership.
  • Translate complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive business outcomes.
  • Collaborate with data engineering and platform teams to ensure data pipelines and models have the appropriate granularity and business logic.
  • Lead deep-dive analyses to understand deviations from forecast, uncover underlying drivers, and recommend corrective actions.
  • Document and socialize key forecasting assumptions, methodologies, and definitions to ensure transparency and alignment across the organization.

Qualifications & Experience...

  • 3+ years of experience in analytics.
  • Significant experience using SQL to explore and analyze large data sets in cloud environments.
  • Experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools such as Looker and Tableau.
  • A proven track record of providing actionable insights that drive business impact in the form of revenue or profit.
  • Logical mindset capable of making appropriate trade-offs between speed and analytical depth without sacrificing quality.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to motivate, collaborate and influence cross-functional partners.
  • Ability to deliver on multiple projects and meet tight deadlines.
  • Ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels.
  • Collaborative approach to partnership.
  • Comfortable communicating with a diverse set of backgrounds, seniority levels, and knowledge sets, particularly in translating complex data concepts to strategic recommendations.
  • A self-starter who is passionate about getting data, using data, making sense of data, and helping others benefit from making analytics driven decisions.

Nice To Haves...

  • Experience building bottom-up forecasts.
  • Experience unpacking gaps to forecast for business leaders in prior roles.
  • BA/BS in statistics, mathematics, economics, or other quantitative discipline.
  • Experience in Python or R.

How We Get Things Done‚Ä¶

This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

Championing Inclusion at WBD

Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

If you‚Äôre a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request.

In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery‚Äôs total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $75,390.00 - $140,010.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Las Vegas, NV (Hybrid)

Salary: $50,000 ‚Äì $55,000 per year, depending on experience

Employment Type: Full-time




About Us:

US Capital Global is a full-service global private financial group headquartered in San Francisco. We specialize in providing sophisticated debt, equity, and investment solutions to middle-market companies and investors around the world.




Role Overview:

We‚Äôre seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst to join our Marketing and Distribution team. This role is pivotal in turning complex datasets into actionable insights to improve investor targeting, campaign performance, and capital distribution outcomes. You‚Äôll collaborate with Marketing and Analyst teams to analyze performance across outreach channels, optimize segmentation strategies, and support real-time decision-making.




Key Responsibilities:

Track and monitor performance of LinkedIn campaigns.
Analyze email and LinkedIn campaign metrics to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Build and maintain performance reports for internal stakeholders.
Create dashboards and reporting tools to track distribution metrics (e.g., opens, clicks, replies, conversions, capital commitments).
Partner with sales and marketing teams to recommend and implement campaign optimizations.
Support deal marketing efforts by analyzing investor behavior, segmenting lists, and monitoring investor funnel progression.
Support data integrity and workflow improvements within our CRM (Salesforce) system.
Help define and track KPIs across investor outreach, business development, and marketing funnels.
Contribute to data enrichment, segmentation, and categorization efforts to improve targeting.
Provide distribution team with regular insights on high-performing investor segments, geography trends, and platform performance.
Identify opportunities to streamline data workflows and automate reporting processes.




Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Economics, Finance, Statistics, or related field.
3+ years of experience in a data analysis, business intelligence, or marketing analytics role.
Proficient in Excel, R, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, or similar).
Expertise in Salesforce.
Familiarity with email and LinkedIn marketing.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with multiple stakeholders.




Why Join Us?

Work with a dynamic and collaborative team shaping the future of private capital markets.
Gain exposure to investor networks, institutional capital, and high-growth companies.
Opportunity to make a tangible impact in both strategy and execution.
Competitive compensation and professional development opportunities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Marwood Group is a leading healthcare advisory and research firm headquartered in New York City with offices in Washington, D.C. and London, England. Marwood Advisory is based out of the NYC office and works with private equity, corporate healthcare, lenders, investment banks, law firms, and other healthcare-focused entities to provide diligence services on prospective transactions and advise their corporate strategies.




The Data Analyst will join a growing analytics team and play a key role in building and scaling Marwood‚Äôs data capabilities across a broad range of engagements. This individual will act as a thought partner to Marwood‚Äôs consulting teams and subject matter experts, applying technical skills, industry knowledge, and intellectual curiosity to develop data-driven analyses and insights that inform healthcare investors and organizations.




Some of the things you'll do




Collaborate with in-house healthcare experts to create new analyses and tools for client engagements, using a combination of public, proprietary, and client-specific data sources.
Conduct research and analysis across industry literature, government and commercial datasets, and company financial information to develop a deep understanding of the U.S. healthcare services landscape and related data.
Work creatively to solve novel client questions by leveraging existing data sources in new and insightful ways.
Design, develop, and manage dashboards on Marwood‚Äôs internal self-service analytics platform for key internal stakeholders.
Help improve internal processes related to data management, quality control, and documentation.




We're looking for someone who has experience with




1‚Äì4 years of professional experience in a data or analytics role.
Proficiency in SQL for efficient data aggregation and analysis of large datasets.
Experience cleansing and transforming data from disparate sources.
Familiarity with cloud-based data warehouses; Snowflake experience is a plus.
Proficiency in business intelligence and data visualization tools (e.g., Sigma Computing, Looker, Tableau).
High proficiency in Excel for data manipulation and presentation.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, including the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and manage multiple concurrent projects and deadlines.




It‚Äôs a plus if you have experience with




Analyzing healthcare-specific datasets, particularly claims and price transparency data.
Familiarity with the U.S. healthcare system, including providers, payers, and industry dynamics.
Knowledge of HIPAA regulations and working with healthcare data environments.
Experience using dbt (data build tool) and GitHub for data modeling and version control.
Proficiency in Python for data preparation and analysis (e.g., pandas, matplotlib).




Marwood offers a comprehensive compensation package with full benefits. We offer a competitive wage, with bonus opportunity, a collaborative work environment and an opportunity to participate in a full benefit package, including, Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, AD&D, Voluntary Life and LTD, Spouse and Dependent Life, 401k Retirement plan with a company match, Commuter, FSA/DCFSA. We offer paid days off, and paid holidays. Marwood prides itself on providing employees with a good work-life balance. There is no travel expected with this position. The position is based in our New York location. Currently working a hybrid schedule. Willing to consider remote.




Please email resume and cover letter as attachments with salary expectations to careers32@Marwoodgroup.com with the subject "Data Analyst".




We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:




Jackson Healthcare is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our growing information technology team! In this position you‚Äôll perform extensive quantitative and qualitative analysis to support business decision-making across the organization. The creation and use of reports and dashboards delivered through the Microsoft Power BI platform and ancillary tools will be central to providing insights to business partners. The ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively is critical to the success of this role.




THIS ROLE IS HYBRID AND REQUIRES RESIDING IN THE ATLANTA AREA. No relocation assistance will be provided with any offer.




ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:




Collaborate frequently with business partners to understand their business processes and identify opportunities to drive better decision-making through data & analytic solutions
Gain familiarity with the data underlying Workday, Salesforce, ServiceNow, M365 and other platforms in use across the organization to draw out actionable insights
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis around various business subject matters, and provide data driven and actionable insights through the creation of reports and data visualizations to facilitate business decision making
Design, develop, test, and support both standard and ad hoc reports and dashboards as requested by business partners
Ensure reports, dashboards and data feeds are secured and follow data governance and security policies
Analyze and interpret results using standard statistical tools and techniques
Develop templates and branding to deliver a consistent and intuitive end-user experience for analytic solutions




QUALIFICATIONS ‚Äì EDUCATION, WORK EXPERIENCE, CERTIFICATIONS:




3-5 years of experience in an analytical role
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Information Technology, or related field or equivalent work experience required
Self-motivated with the ability to define, structure, and prioritize work




KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:




Expertise in building and deploying reports and dashboards in Microsoft Power BI
Familiarity with dimensional database models
Proficient with data visualizations and data storytelling to drive insights and decision-making
Expertise in Microsoft Excel
Excellent communication skills
Experience in mapping business processes and recommending changes to better align with analytical needs
Experience with one or more of the following business platforms preferred: Workday, Salesforce, ServiceNow
Experience in analytics for Human Resources, Insurance, or Medical Billing a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

The Strategy Data Analyst will support the LANEIGE brand team by delivering data-driven insights across key strategic areas including product performance, consumer behavior, and market trends. This role will work closely with cross-functional teams such as Brand Marketing, E-commerce, and Global HQ to inform decision-making and optimize brand growth.




Key Responsibilities




Business Strategy & Performance Analysis

Collaborate with Demand Planning and Sales Account Leads to consolidate inputs and align with monthly net sales targets, contributing to accurate performance tracking and strategic planning.
Collaborate with the Marketing team to manage SKU lists and regularly share updates with relevant departments to ensure alignment and operational efficiency
Manage and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) on a monthly basis using sales and operational data; communicate findings with relevant departments and HQ.
Conduct weekly/monthly sales performance analysis(Sell-thru, Sell-in) and share insights with brand teams and stakeholders, including HQ counterparts.
Generate diversified insights through regular data analysis to support business growth and strategic planning.
Track and report monthly P&L metrics, identifying issues and escalating them to management with actionable recommendations.




Market Intelligence

Conduct periodic and ad-hoc market research to identify key trends in the US market and propose strategic actions for brands (LANEIGE, INNISFREE, HANYUL)
Collaborate with the CMI team and Amazon Team to manage and analyze market data from third-party sources (e.g., Circana, Profitero)
Support brand and corporate teams with consumer and competitive intelligence to enhance market positioning
Work closely with the Brands(LANEIGE, INNISFREE, HANYUL) Marketing team to provide necessary analytical data and support data-driven decision-making(e.g., category, retailer)




Global Corporate Strategy Development

Support new business development initiatives across North and Latin America (e.g., new markets, new channels) by coordinating with internal and external stakeholders.
Review and summarize key HQ documents written in Korean, and share relevant insights with team members and leadership
Ensure alignment between HQ‚Äôs global strategic direction and APUS‚Äôs local strategies through effective communication and data-driven insights.
Assist in the development of short- and long-term business plans by providing relevant data analysis and scenario modeling.
Provide analytical support for regular HQ meetings (weekly/monthly) and key strategic discussions.




Required Qualifications

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, business strategy, or a related role (experience in beauty industry is a plus).
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools (e.g., SAP, Power BI) are a strong plus.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills in English & Korean
Ability to work cross-functionally and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.




Company Benefits

Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
HSA Employer Contributions and FSA Options
401k Participation with company matching.
Discount on all APUS Brands Products
Gratis Program - Gift box with top selling products, twice a year
Paid Maternity Leave
Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance
Paid Time Off: Vacation / Personal days / Sick days
Company offered Mental Counseling for all employees
Office-closed holidays and floating holidays
Company sponsored events
Education assistant Program
Employee Referral Program







AMOREPACIFIC, US, INC is an equal opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We actively seek to maintain a diverse work force, and AMOREPACIFIC US, INC therefore recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, or Vietnam veteran status.
