Title: HSE & Sustainability Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

Waters Corporation is currently seeking a Health, Safety and Environment (HSE) Data Analyst to join the Global Real Estate, Facilities & HSE team. The HSE Data Analyst is an integral part of the HSE team supporting the Waters Health, Safety, Environmental, and Sustainability strategies and initiatives by enabling a culture of data-driven decision making. The HSE Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, interpreting and transforming data into actionable insights and ensuring a high level of data quality for internal and external reporting.

Responsibilities


Manage Global Sustainability & HSE software platforms and associated HR/IT interface.
Leads all troubleshooting efforts for HSE software platform.
Acts as the Subject Matter Expert for the HSE platform. Build training content and conduct trainings as needed.
Manage the HSE and sustainability platform/s and associated HR/ IT interface.
Manage the monthly & quarterly data collection process for metrics and reporting of Sustainability and HSE data.
Develop and implement a standardized process for integrating data into all management software.
Establish and maintain protocols for monitoring and maintaining the integrity and transparency of data intake and validation processes.
Incorporate new metrics and data sources to provide a more comprehensive view of HSE & Sustainability performance.
Implement technological solutions or process enhancements to streamline data collection, analysis, and reporting.
Conduct periodic reviews of sustainability data and invoices to identify anomalies, discrepancies, or potential errors.
Work closely with relevant global teams to resolve issues and ensure data integrity.
Develop and produce regular and ad-hoc reports, dashboards and presentations to support the oversight and management of key metrics, indicators, and trends.
Analyze HSE and sustainability data to identify trends, patterns, areas for improvement, and provide insights and recommendations to management for enhancing the company's HSE and Sustainability performance.
Conduct strategic analysis of current and future HSE and Sustainability data systems‚Äô needs to enhance existing data management and reporting requirements.
Perform ad-hoc analyses in response to customer or shareholder inquiries, or in support of cross-functional projects.
Support the team in the development of risk mitigation strategies based on data driven insights


Qualifications


Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, or metrics development within HSE or compliance-focused environment.
Bachelor of Science Degree or above
Prior experience with HSE data collection and metrics is a plus
Relevant coursework in data analysis, computer science, data extraction, data exploration and data visualization.
Basic Knowledge of web development platforms, databases, and infrastructure.
Demonstrated strong problem solving and analytical skills, strong attention to detail
Strong communications, interpersonal, and organizational skills
Experience using Intelex, Power BI, and Celonis software platforms, preferred


Company Description

Waters Corporation (NYSE:WAT) is a global leader in analytical instruments, separations technologies, and software, serving the life, materials, food, and environmental sciences for over 65 years. Our Company helps ensure the efficacy of medicines, the safety of food and the purity of water, and the quality and sustainability of products used every day. In over 100 countries, our 7,600+ passionate employees collaborate with customers in laboratories, manufacturing sites, and hospitals to accelerate the benefits of pioneering science .

Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. It benefits our employees, our products, our customers and our community. Waters complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Waters is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All hiring decisions are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

Title: Data Modeler (SAP Power Designer or Erwin)/SQL
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client in Merrimack, NH that is seeking a Data Modeler (SAP Power Designer or Erwin)/SQL. Responsibilities:


Blend deep data modeling knowledge and Data Architecture experience to build Data Models for multiple Key initiatives
Committed to staying hands-on, developing your own expertise and knowledge to bring the latest thinking to your role and to enable others with that knowledge
Drive a spirit of innovation and data strategy by building and improving the data modeling and database design practice
Work closely with the business and technical teams and build or assist in the creation of scalable, flexible, and detailed data models that will improve the product offerings and speed time to market
In an agile structure, collaborate with other leaders to establish the standards for your CoE, influence the strategic decisions and build solutions to help scale our business
Guide a team of data modelers who primarily work within autonomous squads across product areas
Partner with project teams, vendors, support organizations, functional architects, systems specialists and other technical resources to bring together information requirements and deliver data modeling solutions for WI Business and technology functions
Improve the overall analysis of business requirements and delivering well architected and efficient
Assist in developing guidelines and standards for the design checklist, governance process and for cataloging and maintaining data repositories
Bring industry thought leadership to WI Technology
Mentor junior data modelers


Requirements


Strong Data modeling (Conceptual, Logical, Physical, 3nF, Dimensional) at both a project and enterprise level
Curiosity about coaching, mentoring, and developing associates
Dimensional Modeling with experience in crafting conformed dimensions that can be used across Business Units.
Data Modeling Tools such as Powerdesigner, Oracle Designer or Erwin
Experience working with Data Engineering and Data Analytics teams
Ability to write SQL to query data (ideally ANSI SQL)
General working knowledge of AI technologies, techniques, and trends


The Skills You Bring


Strong analytic skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to explain Data structures to a non-technical audience
Good interpersonal, negotiating, and influencing skills


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking ‚ÄúApply Today‚Äù you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Computer Vision and Machine Learning Intern
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Convergent Research is a Focused Research Organization aiming to accelerate the adoption of novel microorganisms for biotechnology. They are seeking a Machine Learning Intern to contribute to a 'moonshot' project by building and evaluating vision language models in a scientific research environment.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Work closely with project manager, engineers, and scientists to architect, build, and annotate training datasets for an experimental research setting.

‚Ä¢ Fine-tune VLMs and evaluate/compare model performance.
